choices.C: Find the Service Console for your Autonomous Database, then pick Administration, then Download the Client Credentials (Wallet).
choices.B: Click on the Autonomous Data Warehouse section, pick a database, then Choose Actions, then Download the Wallet.
choices.D: Click on the Object Storage and find your Autonomous Bucket and Download the Wallet Credentials. E. Click the Compute section of the menu, then choose Instance Configurations, then Download Wallet.
choices.A: Click on the Autonomous Data Warehouse in the menu, click a database name, then Choose DB Connection button, then Download the Wallet.

questions.question_text: Which two are correct actions to take in order to Download the Autonomous Database Credentials? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
A and B Are Correct!
Source:https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/paas/autonomous-database/adbsa/connect-download-wallet.html#GUID-B06202D2-0597-41AA-9481-3B174F75D4B1

questions.question_text: How many pre-defined service names are configured in tnsnames.ora for a single Autonomous Transaction Processing database instance, and what are they called?

choices.B: None. There are no pre-defined service names in tnsnames.ora.
choices.A: Two. They are called ATP and ADW.
choices.D: Five. They are called tpurgent, tp, high, medium and low.
choices.C: Three. They are called high, medium and low.

discussion.content:
Yes in case the answer is multi choice then you can go for A and C ,
If the answer is single choice then its A.

https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/paas/autonomous-data-warehouse-cloud/user/connect-preparing.html#GUID-EFAFA00E-54CC-47C7-8C71-E7868279EF3B

In sqlnet.ora : enable connections through an HTTP proxy ( SQLNET.USE_HTTPS_PROXY=on )
In tnsnames.ora : Add the HTTP proxy hostname and port to the connection definitions in tnsnames.ora ( (https_proxy=proxyhostname)(https_proxy_port=80) added in the address section of connection definitions. )

Selected Answer: E
The question does not say to choose two. For me, E is correct.
A is the answer, C is wrong as we just enable HTTP proxy details from it and not add the proxy details

questions.question_text: If you need to connect to Autonomous Data Warehouse (ADW) using Java Database Connectivity (JDBC) via an HTTP proxy, where do you set the proxy details?

discussion.content:

https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/paas/bi-cloud/bilpd/data-sync.html

Use Data Sync to upload, and manage data. You can load data from files (CSV and XLSX), various relational sources (tables, views, SQL statements), OTBI, JDBC data sources, and Oracle Service Cloud. You can load to relational tables or data sets.

questions.question_text:
Your customer receives information in various formats like .csv files from their suppliers. The business user would like to collect all of this information and store it in a ATP environment. The Oracle adviser recommends to use Oracle Data Sync for this.
Which statement is true regarding Oracle Data Sync?

choices.D: Data Sync can only load data from one source into one destination table.
choices.A: Data Sync can only load files into tables (insert-only), the customer has to write the additional code.
choices.B: Data Sync can not transform your data while loading it into the destination table.
choices.C: Data Sync can load a combination of data source, such as .csv, .xlsx and Oracle relational files.

questions.question_text:
The 3rd party application that your customer wants to migrate to Autonomous Database (ADB) has some specific demands like tablespace names, usemames and init.ora parameters. The decision was made to adhere to the suggested migration method using an instant client and the datapump version that was suggested (and came with it).
Which statement is true about the migration of the application's database success?

discussion.content:
Thanks
Correct Ans: C
Explanation:
Autonomous Database configures and optimizes your database. You do not need to perform administration operations for configuring the database. SQL commands used for database administration such as CREATE TABLESPACE are not available. The default data and temporary tablespaces for the database are configured automatically. Adding, removing, or modifying tablespaces is not allowed.
can it be D? please suggest

Answer B is also correct
 If the QUERY parameter includes references to another table with columns whose names match the table being loaded, and if those columns are used in the query, then you must use a table alias to distinguish between columns in the table being loaded, and columns in the SELECT statement with the same name.

Has anybody experienced a blocking error while migrating on-premise database to the ADB without specifying remap value and using impdp command ? Can you please share ?

According to me, if we will not specify anything in remap while using impdp, it will complete and automatically everything gets moved to DATA tablespace. 

Going by above logic, isn't option A is the right answer ?

Correct answer is C
Explanation
Autonomous Database configures and optimizes your database. You do not need to perform administration operations for configuring the database. SQL commands used for database administration such as CREATE TABLESPACE are not available.
The default data and temporary tablespaces for the database are configured automatically. Adding, removing, or modifying tablespaces is not allowed.
There is tablespace creation limitation on ATP. Correct answer should be C

choices.C: The tablespace names will result in a blocking error during datapump import because of ADB limitations.
choices.B: The suggested datapump version will create an alias for non-standard tablespace names so the migration is successful.
choices.D: The migration can be a success, both technically and functional due to datapump enhancements.
choices.A: The migration can be technically a success but the 3-rd party vendor needs to support the result.
